description: Offers day and evening classes for adults at various locations. Programs include: English as a Second Language (ESL), High School Diploma, General Educational Development (GED) Test Preparation, and the California High School Exit Exam (CAHSEE).  Adult Basic Education (reading, writing, and math development), Career Training, Contract Education, Community Education/Interest classes. Also offers Community Based English Tutoring (CBET) which provides classes for parents to improve their English so they can better help their children succeed in school, and Migrant Education which provides educational and support services to eligible migrant students. Cal-WORKs and WIA participants are encouraged  to visit the website for information on programs to fit their needs.The current career training opportunities include: Office Administrative Assistant, Accounting Clerk, English Communications and Computers, Clinical Medical Assisting, Pharmacy Technician, and Online Classes through www.ed2go.com/nhas.
